column4: I can't connect to my tomcat. When I  try to connect through firefox it just keeps loading forever.
have u checked tomcat logs for ooms and hung threads?
check under /usr/ for a tomcat directory
there's a bin, lib and webapps folder there, nothing else
webapps default root is only saying that there is one default apps running in tomcat deployment

thats normal check under there to see if there is a log directory or even start ur find command from that directory under user.. logs are somewhere for tomcat.. all in all unless u plan on patching the application,, i suggest stopping and startig tomcat

its just common to investigate why the instance is hung,, usually oom or out of memory errors ,, hung threads,, or code errors cause these issues,, if u leave tomcat up for some time,, and when u run top if java is always in the top 5 with high cpu usage and rss size u may need to restart the tomcat to make it responsive
okay, there's no logs there though
just an index.html file and a context.xml
how did u install tomcat is a better question? tomcat can basically just be placed anywhere and told where java is..
awesome,, now i guess just check for those type of errors i usually like to do this,,,
thanks! It turned out I forot a quote when I edited in tomcat-users.xml
